div.class: hJDwNd-AhqUyc-uQSCkd jXK9ad D2fZ2 OjCsFc wHaque GNzUNc

h1.div: SOUTHERN VERMONT FOOD RESOURCES from Retreat Farm Website

h3.div: WSESU Meals-For WSESU students in need of lunch/breakfast. If you can't access the survey please use the phone #'s listed below to leave a message for: Ali West ( 802-257-3322) Justin McArdle (802-451-3558)

Groundworks- "Foodworks, our food shelf program, has moved to a food delivery model as of Monday, March 16th. Staff will be handing out pre-prepared boxes of food for those arriving on-site until this change has been thoroughly communicated. Households in need of food are asked to COMPLETE THIS SURVEY if possible, or contact Foodworks at 802-490-2412 to request delivery. We are actively preparing a list of volunteers willing to make deliveries and are in urgent need of volunteer support for this. We have set up protocols to keep staff, volunteers and clients as safe as possible. Please complete the Mutual Aid Survey if you are able to help.
St. Brigid's Kitchen-Brigid's Kitchen serves meals on: Mondays, Wednesdays, Thursdays and Saturdays- 11:30 AM to 12:30 PM.
Bellows Falls Area Senior Center- The center is closed to the public but meals can be picked up for grab & go. Call (802) 463-3907 before 10am. They are still running the Meals on Wheels program.
Brattleboro Senior Solutions- Offering grab & go from 11am-11:30am. The Meals on Wheels program is still operating. Please call ahead Chris Macavoy; Senior Helpline: 802-885-2669.
Chester Andover Family Center-Open to Chester Andover residents only. Thrift shop closed until April 16. Food Shelf open during normal hours (Thurs 1:00- 5 pm, Fri. 10-2 pm) for grab & go model.
Deerfield Valley Food Pantry- Continuing bi-monthly distribution: March 19th 1-3; March 21st 9-11. Delivery will be made directly to vehicles.
Guilford Cares Food Pantry-Continue to open on Thursdays from 5-6pm. Clients have a shopping list and doing a grab & go model.
Loaves & Fishes-Grab & go meals for folks who come to the door. No one is allowed inside the pantry. Operating Tuesdays & Fridays, 11:00 am-12:30pm.
Our Place Drop-In Center-Serving grab & go breakfast and lunch. One person at-a-time in the pantry. Current hours: M,T,W,F 8am-2pm.
Putney Food Shelf-Drive-up grab & go model.
Second Congregational Church, Londonderry-Grab & go model during normal hours: 3rd Friday of the month 1-4pm.
Springfield Family Center-Food shelf is open by appointment (call ahead) for grab & go supplies. Doing grab & go community lunch program. Both are open M,T,F.
Townshend Community Food Shelf-Continue to open on Mondays from 6-7:30pm with a procedure in place for social distancing. Volunteers are doing home-deliveries as necessary.

div.class: hJDwNd-AhqUyc-uQSCkd jXK9ad D2fZ2 OjCsFc wHaque GNzUNc

h2.div: Hope and Help-From A letter from Retreat Farm

div.jsaction: click:cOuCgd; mousedown:UX7yZ; mouseup:lbsD7e; mouseenter:tfO1Yc; mouseleave:JywGue; focus:AHmuwe; blur:O22p3e; contextmenu:mg9Pef;

h3.div: Retreat Farm staff members Lu and Carissa spent Wednesday packing up grocery bags brimming with food for people in our community, while our the rest of our team worked behind the scenes to pull it all together. What started as a spontaneous response to the crisis has grown into Retreat Farm’s Emergency Food Pantry.
We're now distributing 50 bags of food to people who desperately need them. And our waiting list for next week is already full.

This Emergency Food Pantry is very much a homegrown effort. Lu, our Program Director, filled her car a making trip after trip to the Brattleboro Coop and Hannafords this week to obtain food for these families. We are working on sourcing food from the VT Foodbank, but they too are running short.
You can give these folks a sense of hope in a dark time.
Can you contribute $50 to help our neighbors in need? Every dollar you donate will go straight to paying for bags full of food for people who need it more than we can imagine.

h3.div: In gratitude,
Wendy Ferris
